revised_title: James Chadwick and the Atomic Bomb: A Historical Overview
tldr: This article discusses the life and work of James Chadwick, a renowned physicist who discovered the neutron. It highlights his role in the development of the atomic bomb during World War II and his contributions to the scientific community. Chadwick's work on uranium fission and his skepticism about the possibility of an atomic bomb eventually changed when he read Niels Bohr and John Wheeler's paper, leading him to participate in the race to develop the bomb.
